author: terencechain
content: https://twitter.com/tbenr/status/1562176272427622402 <@504202741933932544> this looks amazing!! any chance other clients can use it down the road? ðŸ˜„ cc <@755590043632140352>

author: tbenr
content:
It should be a big problem to make it compatible with other data format. If clients could share their protodump file here I can make it work for them.
btw it is here: https://github.com/tbenr/protovis
the code is very messy and unclean. just a result of copy\paste here and there ðŸ™‚

author: potuz
content: is it dependant on protoarray in a deep way?

author: tbenr
content: it has the concepts of node slot (and epoch, for the background grid), weight (for dot sizes) and executionblock hash (for pandas and merge point). It also has validation concept (for node color)

author: tbenr
content: so it is pretty tailored for the protoarray

author: tbenr
content: it doesn't have the concept of justification\finalization yet. But it shows the data for the nodes

author: potuz
content: Perfect, thanks I'm working on something similar but then I'll just focus on a different part and rely on your tool. It takes a JSON with those fields?

author: potuz
content: We just removed the forkchoice dump endpoint cause it was a good time for a breaking change and it was borked due to having different forkchoice implementations. I will reinsert it only for the tree structure, not the protoarray one. But the dump should be a strict superset of the information you have there. with the caveat that I don't have the checkpoints, just the epochs.

author: potuz
content: I already have a user request: I would draw the weights in a different way: I'd draw larger the descendant of the heaviest chain: so that when observing a branch I can quickly identify the canonical and first/second contending branch

author: tbenr
content: I was thinking about better identify canonical chain. I'll check it.

author: tbenr
content: If you share your dump json I can make it load and start being multi client
